thread.title: Ranji Trophy 2015-16 round 1 recap: Jadeja, Pathania make a splash
thread.title_full: Ranji Trophy 2015-16 round 1 recap: Jadeja, Pathania make a splash - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: Ranji Trophy 2015-16 round 1 recap: Jadeja, Pathania make a splash
text:
Round one of the 2015-16 Ranji Trophy season - starting on October 1 as opposed to the previous season which began in December keeping in mind the ICC World Cup - was an eventful one, with four outright wins and two engaging draws between Rajasthan and Delhi and Kerala and Jammu & Kashmir. The competition's first phase also saw 21 centuries scored and 14 five-wicket hauls then, with Punjab's 30-year-old Varun Khanna returning the best innings figures (8/97) and Services' debutant Diwesh Pathania (13/83) the best match figures of the season.
Read on for a recap of the highs and lows and in-betweens of round one.
Jadeja runs over Tripura
Dropped from all formats for the Indian team, Ravindra Jadeja marked his return to domestic cricket with an emphatic all-round performance that helped Saurashtra drub Tripura by an innings and 118 runs at Rajkot. With the bat, he first made 91 to help the hosts to 307, but it was his left-arm spin that really crippled Tripura. Jadeja's exceptional figures of 27.1-13-27-6 bowled Tripura out for 103, and following on the visitors slumped to 86 in 53 overs with Jadeja adding five more wickets to end with match figures of 11/72.
Punjab trample over Railways
Just days after he was named for the first time in an Indian squad, Punjab allrounder Gurkeerat Singh Mann stroked the first double-century of the season, a superb unbeaten 201 to help set up his team's innings victory over Railways in Mohali. Gurkeerat's bullish 207-ball innings came after centuries from Uday Kaul (112) and Mandeep Singh (109) and with Gitansh Khera (102*) he put on 306 for the sixth wicket. A total of 604/5 declared saw Railways wilt for 196 and 282, with Man-of-the-Match Brainder Sran claiming 6/61 in the first innings and spinner Khanna taking 8/97 in the second.
Spin dominates at Chepauk
Arguably the most engaging match of the round was between Tamil Nadu and Baroda, a low-scorer in Chennai that the hosts won by seven runs. Baroda's spinners bowled Tamil Nadu out for 125 on day one, but the home team's tweakers did well to restrict Baroda to 159. Another poor batting effort of 155 left Tamil Nadu to defend 121, which they did in enthralling manner. Rahil Shah backed his four first-innings wickets with 5/43 as Baroda ended on 114.
Pathania's stunning debut
At their home ground in Palam, Services marked their campaign opener with a nine-wicket win over Jharkhand. This win marked a remarkable debut for 26-year-old seam bowler Diwesh Pathania, who claimed 13/83. His 6/19 ran sent Jharkhand crashing to 45 all out on day one, which surpassed their previous lowest total of 81 by some distance. Seven more wickets in Jharkhand's second innings consigned the visitors to a huge defeat.
Karnataka stay unbeaten but concede points
At the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati, hosts Assam gave defending champions Karnataka a tough fight to take three first-innings lead points over them. Leading the way was former Karnataka spinner J Syed Mohammad with 7/44 to bowl out Karnataka for 187, after which Assam eked out a narrow lead in making 194. Karnataka rallied in their second innings, led by opener Ravikumar Samarth's 131. Set a target of 388, Assam were carried to 259/6 by J Arun Kartik's unbeaten 115. While they didn't win, Karnataka extended their unbeaten streak to 31.
Kerala almost pull it off
In Srinagar, Kerala came close to an improbable victory over Jammu & Kashmir but ultimately had to settle for three first-innings points. Having made 485 in reply to J&K's 330, with Sachin Baby (151) and skipper Sanju Samson (101) the chief contributors, Kerala bowled out the hosts for 225 to leave themselves a target of 71 in eight overs. But once they slipped to 28.3 in 5.4 overs, the route taken was one of safety and the match was drawn with Kerala 44/4 in eight overs.
And then some ...
In Nagpur, India fast bowler Umesh Yadav struck his maiden first-class century off 106 balls, the second quickest by a Vidarbha player.
In his 100th first-class match, Tamil Nadu opener Abhinav Mukund made twin scores of 0.
Young Sarfaraz Khan marked his first appearance for his home state of Uttar Pradesh with 155 from 164 balls out of a total of 686/7.
